metadata.Title: CVE-2021-29264 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description: An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel through 5.11.10.drivers/net/ethernet/freescale/gianfar.c in the Freescale Gianfar Ethernetdriver allows attackers to cause a system crash because a negative fragmentsize is calculated in situations involving an rx queue overrun when jumbopackets are used and NAPI is enabled, aka CID-d8861bab48b6.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
